properties.name: Artificial intelligence looks after the old
properties.description: Five years from now grandma might well be kept safe from harm by a computerised carer. Sensors controlled by what scientists call “fuzzy logic” will allow the computer to monitor her and make decisions in the same way that humans do – and call for help if grandma does something out of the ordinary, like fall out of bed or fail to answer the front door.
properties.statement: Old people deserve the very best that science has to offer
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4299">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Charging up with solar power
properties.description: Africa has seen a huge growth in mobile phone use despite a lack of electricity to charge them up. Instead people use car batteries, which are ultimately powered by petrol. However, the falling cost of solar cells and the near unlimited sunshine in Africa mean that solar energy will soon be used to power not just mobiles but low energy lights and water filters too.
properties.statement: Technology will reduce pollution
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4279">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Charging up with wind
properties.description: At Glastonbury 2007 festival sponsor Orange showed off a wind-powered mobile phone charger. Small enough to fit in your rucksack and light enough to attach to the top of your tent, the charger can also convert the vibrations caused by the turning rotor blades to provide electricity for a night light.
properties.statement: Develop carbon-free power
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4322">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Colour changing clothes
properties.description: Textiles that can change colour with the flick of a micro switch may soon mean the wearer becomes so well camouflaged as to be all but invisible. Threads made from electrochromic polymers (go ask a scientist!) can change colour, creating clothes that allow the wearer to blend seamlessly into the background and effectively disappear from sight.
properties.statement: Science affects every aspect of our life
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4316">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Deforestation and climate change
properties.description: The forests of Indonesia and Brazil are home to some of the largest carbon stores in the world. But when these forests are chopped down or burnt that carbon is released into the atmosphere, adding massively to the carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases that are already driving climate change.
properties.statement: Encourage the use of sustainable forests
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4288">Read more and explore jobs linked to animal conservation</a>

properties.name: Empowering Ugandan farmers
properties.description: A mobile text service is helping farmers get more money for their produce. In the past farmers have accepted much less for their crops because they haven't known the true market price. With this text service from Foodnet, which lets them know how much food is being sold for in local markets, they can keep up to date and so are in a much stronger negotiating position.
properties.statement: Technology can bring equality to the world
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4279">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Extinction of the Golden Toad
properties.description: Not spied since 1989, the Costa Rican Golden Toad may be no more. From a peak population of several thousand in 1967, numbers declined rapidly until by 1988 there were thought to be just ten left – but not one has been seen since 1989. Their disappearance may be the result of climate change, increased UV-radiation penetration or pollution.
properties.statement: Animal conservation can protect animal habitats
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4288">Read more and explore jobs linked to animal conservation</a>

properties.name: Fabrics which produce electricity when they move
properties.description: US scientists have developed a fabric that produces electricity when it moves. Special nanotube-coated Kevlar fibres in the fabric produce electricity when they flex and with a little more work scientists hope to be able to harness this ‘trouser power’ to charge mobile phones and MP3 players.
properties.statement: Energy efficiency is the way forward
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4316">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Fly control for herdsmen
properties.description: Tsetse flies (it’s pronounced “Tet-see”) are small blood-sucking insects that carry two diseases. Both can kill cattle if left untreated. But these scientists tested DNA from blood that the flies had sucked and found that it was mostly older animals getting bitten. This meant that farmers were able to save money by only treating older cows against the diseases.
properties.statement: Biology is key to understanding plants and animals
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.tsetse.org/">Read more about controlling tsetse</a>

properties.name: Improving road networks
properties.description: Engineers from the Transport Research Laboratory work throughout Africa and Asia to improve road networks, providing technical information and training so local engineers and governments can plan, design, build and maintain their own safe road networks. They also advise governments on affordable and sustainable road improvement programmes.
properties.statement: Building roads can build understanding
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4306">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Out of the game
properties.description: When England striker Michael Owen was stretchered off during a crucial game against Sweden during the 2006 World Cup the team doctor, Leif Sward, knew straight away that something was seriously wrong. His worse fears were confirmed when an MRI scan revealed massive damage to the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) in Owen’s knee.
properties.statement: Science and sport are a winning team
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4296">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Paying by mobile
properties.description: In countries where few people have bank accounts or credit cards it’s now possible to send money by mobile phone. The service works by someone paying money into their mobile account and then selecting the “transfer money” option on their phone. A text, which acts a bit like a cheque, is then sent and the person who receives it can cash it whenever they like.
properties.statement: Innovation can complement tradition
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4279">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: ROSS
properties.description: A two-in-one water carrier and sanitiser designed to bring safe water to nearly a billion people globally has been created by James Brown and Amanda Jones, founders of the Red Button Design. The designers recently presented their invention on BBC 2's The Dragons' Den and won the best deal ever seen on the programme.
properties.statement: Good design can save lives
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4320">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Reconstructive surgery
properties.description: The surgeon who repaired Michael Owen’s knee, which was injured during the 2006 World Cup game against Sweden, used tissue grafted from tendons around the footballer’s kneecap and hamstring to build a new tendon. Using screws, he then attached this to bones above and below Owen’s knee, replacing the injured player’s anterior cruciate ligament (ACL).
properties.statement: Reconstructive surgery is a benefit for all
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4296">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Remote control by eye
properties.description: Computer scientists are developing an electronic system that tracks eye movement to allow severely disabled people to control devices just by looking at them. It’s going to take some seriously clever computing to make the system fool-proof, but once perfected it will really help those who currently have almost no control over their environment.
properties.statement: Innovative scientific design can bring independence
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4299">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Robot minders
properties.description: Robots will soon be able to help old people around the house – or simply keep an eye on them. Japan is the world leader in robotics research, and one Japanese care home already uses robotic teddy bears to make sure people are OK. Robotic care could be a big business in the future as there will soon be lots of old people who’ll need looking after.
properties.statement: Robots could provide cheaper healthcare
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4299">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Robot or 'entbot'?
properties.description: As ever more life-like robots are built, the boundary between service robot and entertainment robot – or “entbot” – is blurring. Asimo, probably the most famous robot to date, can serve drinks or act as a tour guide. But whether we end up in a world where one robot will do all our bidding or where a small army of robots will cook and clean for us remains uncertain.
properties.statement: Science and technology are part of our life
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4243">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Robotic household appliances
properties.description: Robot lawnmowers could soon be a common sight. Looking like large beetles, these high-tech grass clippers are kept in check by a wire around the edge of the lawn which stops them wandering off into the flower beds. Other models, robotic cousins if you will, can clean your pool, vacuum your carpet or clear away your laundry…and all without a word of complaint.
properties.statement: Scientific innovation can create new business
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4243">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Self-cleaning fabrics
properties.description: One of the latest developments in textile technology is a fabric that can clean itself. A clever coating of nanoparticles only a few molecules thick gives the fabric the ability to shrug off stains and stinks (with a little help from the sun). If used on silk and wool, which are difficult and expensive to clean, this could mark the end of the 'dry clean only' label.
properties.statement: Science and business drive innovation
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4316">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Speech recognition
properties.description: Speech recognition software can help many people, especially those with dyslexia or who have difficulty operating a keyboard. Simply speak into a microphone and the computer software converts your words into text on the screen, comparing the sounds of the words spoken by you to those held by the software in order to find the closest match.
properties.statement: Technology is changing the world
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4317">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Supply of clean and safe water
properties.description: We take clean water for granted, but an eighth of the world’s population cannot. An astonishing two million people die every year from water-related diseases. Add to this the fact that 2.5 billion people worldwide live without access to hygienic toilet facilities and the death toll rises, with more than 5,000 children a day dying as a result of diarrhoeal diseases.
properties.statement: Science can provide clean water with our help
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4320">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: The last of the great apes in Africa
properties.description: The great apes are facing extinction at the hands of man. Habitat destruction and the growth in the illegal bush meat trade means that the apes may disappear within your lifetime. The Great Apes Survival Project (GRASP) is one group campaigning to protect the apes.
properties.statement: Protect animal habitats!
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4288">Read more and explore jobs linked to animal conservation</a>

properties.name: The power of thought
properties.description: Sounds like Sci-Fi? Well you might be surprised to hear that four people have already done this, with each of them operating a computer that was able to read their thoughts and respond to their commands. These pioneers were hooked up to the computer by means of electrodes attached to the surface of their brains. Not bad, eh? So, what did you do today?
properties.statement: Computers are for everyone
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4317">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: The road to recovery
properties.description: Top-notch physios fixed injured England star Michael Owen with a programme of gentle exercise building to aggressive leg strengthening work and eventually some swimming, cycling and running. Within three months of major surgery Owen was back on the ball, and all thanks to the work of those fantastic physios.
properties.statement: Sports science can help ordinary people
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4296">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Threatened survival of Antarctic penguins
properties.description: The effects of global warming are five times worse in the Antarctic Peninsula than the rest of the world, claim scientists working for the World Wildlife Fund (WWF). The nesting grounds of the emperor, gentoo, chinstrap and Adélie penguins are literally melting away, while over-fishing means that food is becoming increasingly difficult for the hungry birds to find.
properties.statement: The melting of the Antarctic affects biodiversity globally
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4288">Read more and explore jobs linked to animal conservation</a>

properties.name: Too much energy
properties.description: Using renewable energy to charge your phone, MP3 player or camera is a great way to do your bit to stop climate change. If left plugged in phone chargers carry on eating up electricity, but fortunately wind-up and solar-powered chargers are already available. Although the technology is still very new it might one day power the entire mobile phone network.
properties.statement: Science and technology will free us from fossil fuels
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4322">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>

properties.name: Wanted: Biomedical scientists for Africa
properties.description: Voluntary Service Overseas (VSO) is a charity that arranges for professionals to work in developing countries in exchange for a small living allowance and accommodation. Right now, VSO is appealing for biomedical scientists like Zonya Jeffrey. She found her experience with VSO in Tanzania really rewarding, and not just personally – it helped her career too!
properties.statement: Encourage people to volunteer

properties.name: World Water Day
properties.description: World Water Day aims to raise awareness of those people around the world who lack access to clean, safe water. Held every March 22 since 1993, it also serves as a reminder for governments to take action. WaterAid, an international charity, campaigns on this issue and offers practical help. Why not take a look at some of WaterAid's work?
properties.statement: Work with charities to provide safe water
properties.link: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.futuremorph.org/my_future_finder/viewitem.cfm?cit_id=4320">Read more and explore jobs linked to this area</a>
